messages.subject: Re: how hot is it where º   Uº R???
messages.msgSnippet: This reminds me of a rather funny story.  On a business trip, DH had to go visit the NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration)
messages.messageBody:
This reminds me of a rather funny story. On a business trip, DH had
to go visit the NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration)
http://www.noaa.gov/ . One of the guys there told him that congress
wanted to get rid of NOAA . Well, he told him, they couldn't. The
congressmen told him, they didn't need that organization any more,
that they could just get the weather reports from the Weather
Channel. He said, "Sir, that is where the weather channel gets their
information!"!!! True story!

Kim--Southern California, where it is 84 degrees with a gentle breeze
and rather nice today!

messages.messageBody:
a good friend of mine is a meterologist w/ an Austin tv station and he's
told stories about IRRATE viewers calling the station to COMPLAIN about
*HIS* forecasts ... wellllllll, he takes it in stride and BLAMES the NWS
(National Weather Service), saying "I just forecast the info they've given
me" ... lol ...

Pris ~> who'd LOVE to see some puffy BLACK clouds out my window right about
now :I
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...

>
> That's it. Now I know what I want to be when I grow up! A weather
person.
> Think about it, they get paid the big bucks (not the guys on the tv but
> the ones who put the info together for them) and they don't get demoted or
> earn anything less if they are wrong more than 50% of the time! Now
> there's the ultimate goldbrick job with security cause no one ever expects
> them to be really right or on the money with their predictions!
>
> Lynda
